title: Antennaria racemosa - racemose pussytoes
description: Antennaria racemosa growing in the open understory of mostly lodgepole pine (Pinus contorta) and some Douglas fir (Pseudotsuga menziesii). Well developed basal leaves with green upper and white hairy lower surfaces combined with Antennaria flowering heads arranged in an open panicle distinguish the understory-inhabiting Antennaria racemosa. This forest was recently thinned by mastication of selected trees and so plants are covered or mostly so with masticated or chipped wood. This site lies north of the Jack Creek road and Moonlight Basin, Madison County, Montana.
label: Original
